TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Create New Contact
  • How to Associate a Company on an Existing Contact
    • How to Enable a Contact to see all tickets for a company
  • Updating a Contact's Default Site
  • Also see
    • How/when to merge duplicate contacts
    • Phone Number Format 

Create New Contact

When creating a contact, even if they are on the phone, try to get an email address from them (even if it's a generic store one) so that Freshdesk can send them ticket updates.

  • A contact must have a unique mobile phone number or email (work phone is a generic number for the location and can be on several contacts). If a contact already exists for a mobile phone or email which you are trying to create a new contact for, then it's likely the are using a generic or store email or phone:
    • You can edit the existing contact to add a Note
  • Make sure you associate a company with a contact, and set the appropriate language and time zone
  • Assign them a default Site for that company if you can find it out
  • Always click the Send Activation Email button to give them a chance to use the portal even if you are adding a contact from a phone call
  • You can ignore the "Activation email to be sent" checkbox when creating a contact because it is only used for customers signing up from the portal


How to Associate a Company on an Existing Contact

Click the Edit button if this is an existing contact. as shown below. Scroll down and search for the company name and click on it. You can associate more than one company to a contact if there is a special reason to do so.


How to Enable a Contact to see all tickets for a company

If you are sure that the contact (e.g. someone from HQ) is allowed to see all tickets for their company, simply click the button highlighted below.

 

Updating a Contact's Default Site

To update a contact's default site, you need to edit the contact.

Unlike the portal, the site dropdown list will not be filtered to just sites for the contact's company, so you will need to search for a site name (might be best to open the company record and look at the list of sites to see/find the name you need to search for)

title: Deleting a Contact
text: When you delete a contact, all further phone calls and emails from them will be marked as Spam. This is a problem for shared email addresses and phone numbers because any other emails from that address won't be seen in Freshdesk and any calls to Freshcaller from that number will be automatically cut off before it even rings! You can Check for blocked calls and unblock contacts but unless there's an exceptional reason, you should always Permanently Delete contacts to avoid issues as shown below.

title: Activating customer registrations from the portal
text: As explained to customers in How to register to use the portal , when customers sign up, we need to review the contact to make sure it's a valid one (not a bot/spam). These contacts can be found in the following view Contacts : Activation email to be sent You can also activate an existing contact who has not signed up from the portal if they ask you to do so (check the below steps to make sure all data is correct on the contact first) Before/to activate a contact for the portal, do the following: Edit the contact Add the correct company - the customer us asked to type in their company name when registering - If they have sent an email from their company's domain (e.g. @t-mobile.com), consider asking to have the domain added to the company record as per Changing a Company (if it's not already) - If you can't match them to a company, you can raise a new Service Request ticket for this contact and ask them for more information to work it out Add a default site if you know their store/location Untick the "Activation email to be sent" checkbox (because you will be doing this next) Save changes to the contact Click the "Send activation email" button
description:
As explained to customers in How to register to use the portal , when customers sign up, we need to review the contact to make sure it's a valid one (not a bot/spam). These contacts can be found in the following view Contacts : Activation email to be sent 



You can also activate an existing contact who has not signed up from the portal if they ask you to do so (check the below steps to make sure all data is correct on the contact first)


Before/to activate a contact for the portal, do the following:

  1. Edit the contact
  2. Add the correct company - the customer us asked to type in their company name when registering
    - If they have sent an email from their company's domain (e.g. @t-mobile.com), consider asking to have the domain added to the company record as per Changing a Company (if it's not already)
    - If you can't match them to a company, you can raise a new Service Request ticket for this contact and ask them for more information to work it out
  3. Add a default site if you know their store/location
  4. Untick the "Activation email to be sent" checkbox (because you will be doing this next)
  5. Save changes to the contact 
  6. Click the "Send activation email" button

title: Unknown Customers !
text: If a ticket is tagged with "Unknown Customer", you must edit/create the contact before working on the ticket so that there is a proper contact associated with a Company as per Creating and Editing Contacts. Once you have done this, please remove the "Unknown customer" tag.

title: Adding or Editing a Site / Store
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Background Info Adding a Site to a Company Updating a Contact's Default Site Updating the Site on a Ticket Background Info Every ticket should be associated with a Site. A site might be a store, a head office, a visitor attraction café etc. Site is an custom entity in Freshdesk which has to have the Site name globally unique. Therefore you won't be able to add a site which is something like "Harlow" if there is already one called that for the same or any other company. You might need to include the store number, or part of the Company name to make it unique (including part of whole company name will make the sites easy to find). Adding a Site to a Company Every Company should have a Site named "zz Not Listed - please include in Description [022385]" where the numbers in brackets make it unique, and the "zz" at the beginning sorts it to the bottom of the list. If you see any tickets with no Site name (which only happens as a fall-back for if there are no Sites at all for a Company) or one of the zz Not Listed sites, the customer should have told us the proper/real site name in the ticket Description, but if not, please do ask the customer for the Site Name so that you can:: Add it here. Update the site on the ticket with the new site name. Note that when you change a Site, you need to click the Update button If this is the first ticket that a contact has entered from the portal, it will be set as their default, so update the contact's default site to the new site as well Contacts can also have a default site set which means when logging a ticket via portal (or if a support agent does it manually), the default Site is pre-selected (it can be changed from the default to any other Site for the same company). When a customer enters their first ticket via the portal, the Site they select is made their default. Updating a Contact's Default Site To update a contact's default site, you need to edit the contact. Unlike the portal, the site dropdown list will not be filtered to just sites for the contact's company, so you will need to search for a site name (might be best to open the company record and look at the list of sites to see/find the name you need to search for). This will set their default site for all new tickets they raise (it won't change existing tickets if you change the default site) Updating the Site on a Ticket You can edit a Site on a ticket by simply choosing a new one from the dropdown, but bear in mind that the Site search box will show you all sites for all companies, so filter/search carefully!
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Background Info
  • Adding a Site to a Company
  • Updating a Contact's Default Site
  • Updating the Site on a Ticket

Background Info

Every ticket should be associated with a Site. A site might be a store, a head office, a visitor attraction café etc.


Site is an custom entity in Freshdesk which has to have the Site name globally unique. Therefore you won't be able to add a site which is something like "Harlow" if there is already one called that for the same or any other company. You might need to include the store number, or part of the Company name to make it unique (including part of whole company name will make the sites easy to find).


Adding a Site to a Company

Every Company should have a Site named "zz Not Listed - please include in Description [022385]" where the numbers in brackets make it unique, and the "zz" at the beginning sorts it to the bottom of the list. If you see any tickets with no Site name (which only happens as a fall-back for if there are no Sites at all for a Company) or one of the zz Not Listed sites, the customer should have told us the proper/real site name in the ticket Description, but if not, please do ask the customer for the Site Name so that you can::

  1. Add it here.
  2. Update the site on the ticket with the new site name. Note that when you change a Site, you need to click the Update button
  3. If this is the first ticket that a contact has entered from the portal, it will be set as their default, so update the contact's default site to the new site as well


Contacts can also have a default site set which means when logging a ticket via portal (or if a support agent does it manually), the default Site is pre-selected (it can be changed from the default to any other Site for the same company).


When a customer enters their first ticket via the portal, the Site they select is made their default.


Updating a Contact's Default Site

To update a contact's default site, you need to edit the contact.

Unlike the portal, the site dropdown list will not be filtered to just sites for the contact's company, so you will need to search for a site name (might be best to open the company record and look at the list of sites to see/find the name you need to search for). This will set their default site for all new tickets they raise (it won't change existing tickets if you change the default site)


Updating the Site on a Ticket

You can edit a Site on a ticket by simply choosing a new one from the dropdown, but bear in mind that the Site search box will show you all sites for all companies, so filter/search carefully!

title: Adding or Changing a Company
text: The Company records are not editable by support agents because certain information is imported from CRM and must remain unchanged. Data you may want to change includes adding the company domain (so any emails from that domain are automatically assigned to the correct company if the contact email from address is not known) , product, VIP customer etc. If so, then please email the the Support managers who have the necessary access permissions to make the edit. New companies should be imported from CRM, but if a company is missing, then also please contact a Support manager who can verify its existence in CRM, and add manually to Freshdesk (if it's imported later, it will just update the existing company. Note that a Site needs to be added as well as an unlisted sites (which has the format "zz Not Listed - please include in Description [022385]" (starts with "zz" to sort it to the bottom of the list of Sites on the dropdown, and where the number in the bracket is the CRM account number because Sites have to be globally unique (i..e not just unique for a Company) Although companies have contracts which specify the products, we also need to assign products to companies because this is what the knowledgebase filters on when deciding what to show on the customer portal

title: How to Handle Ex Customers and Closed Sites
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Company Record Sites Contracts Contacts Tickets Company Record If a company is no longer a customer, one of the Support management team will update the company record: Tick them as On Stop Set CRM Account Type as Ex Customer Rename the customer to start with "EX-CUSTOMER - " By changing the CRM Account Type to ex-customer, most views and reports should ignore these companies Companies are not deleted because unlike contacts which can be reinstated after deletion, companies are deleted permanently. Their tickets would remain in the system, as would related contacts, but we may want to search for all tickets for ex customers, so it's best not to delete companies for at least 12 months after they have left us. It's also useful to keep them there so that if a request does come in for an ex-company, you'll be able to find the company and realise that it's an ex-customer. Sites Sites should be renamed to start with "CLOSED - " if they are just a closed store/location, but if the Company is an ex-customer, then the Site records should be deleted. Contracts The contract records should be deleted. This will avoid them showing up in expired contract reports. Contacts Delete all contacts so that any emails they send will go to spam, and not generate a new ticket. If you want to leave a grace period, make sure you set a ToDo with reminder to delete the contact in a week's time (after which all their emails will be moved to spam and not create a ticket) Tickets As highlighted below, this means that you should not work on the ticket except to reply to say that they no longer have a support contract, and so you will be closing the ticket.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Company Record
  • Sites
  • Contracts
  • Contacts
  • Tickets


Company Record

If a company is no longer a customer, one of the Support management team will update the company record:

  1. Tick them as On Stop
  2. Set CRM Account Type as Ex Customer
  3. Rename the customer to start with "EX-CUSTOMER - "

By changing the CRM Account Type to ex-customer, most views and reports should ignore these companies



Companies are not deleted because unlike contacts which can be reinstated after deletion, companies are deleted permanently. Their tickets would remain in the system, as would related contacts, but we may want to search for all tickets for ex customers, so it's best not to delete companies for at least 12 months after they have left us.

It's also useful to keep them there so that if a request does come in for an ex-company, you'll be able to find the company and realise that it's an ex-customer.


Sites

Sites should be renamed to start with "CLOSED - " if they are just a closed store/location, but if the Company is an ex-customer, then the Site records should be deleted.


Contracts

The contract records should be deleted. This will avoid them showing up in expired contract reports.


Contacts

Delete all contacts so that any emails they send will go to spam, and not generate a new ticket.

If you want to leave a grace period, make sure you set a ToDo with reminder to delete the contact in a week's time (after which all their emails will be moved to spam and not create a ticket)




Tickets

As highlighted below, this means that you should not work on the ticket except to reply to say that they no longer have a support contract, and so you will be closing the ticket.
